description: The Block C competition at the Corrida Colosseum intensifies as Lucy battles through numerous fighters. Kelly Funk's Jake Jake no Mi powers are revealed before Sai defeats him. The final two competitors, Lucy and Don Chinjao, clash with powerful Haki in an explosive confrontation.

events.title: Block C Battle Royale Continues
events.description: Multiple competitors in Block C continue battling. Lucy squares off against Jean the Bandit while Kelly Funk, Chinjao, Sai, and Ideo eliminate other fighters.
events.significance: Shows the intensity of the competition and the skill level of the remaining fighters in Block C.

events.title: Kelly Funk's Jake Jake no Mi Revealed
events.description: Kelly Funk reveals his Jake Jake no Mi Devil Fruit power, transforming into a jacket that his brother Bobby can wear. This allows Kelly to control Bobby's powerful body while combining their strengths.
events.significance: First reveal of the Jake Jake no Mi's abilities, showing one of the more unusual Devil Fruit powers in the series.

quotes.text: I ate the Jake Jake no Mi! I'm a Jacket Human!
quotes.speaker: Kelly Funk
quotes.context: Kelly reveals his Devil Fruit ability

events.title: Sai Defeats Kelly Funk
events.description: After Kelly defeats Boo using Bobby's strength, Sai confronts the Funk Brothers. Sai blocks Kelly's Rarara Rambo punches and defeats him with a powerful kick, avenging his comrade.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sai's combat abilities and loyalty to his crew members, establishing him as a formidable fighter.

quotes.text: As a leader, I will always avenge my men!
quotes.speaker: Sai
quotes.context: Sai confronts Kelly Funk after Boo's defeat

events.title: Sai vs Ideo Confrontation
events.description: After defeating Kelly Funk, Sai prepares to face off against Ideo, the Destruction Cannon. The two powerful fighters prepare to clash.
events.significance: Sets up a battle between two skilled martial artists competing for the Mera Mera no Mi.

events.title: Giolla Confronts Straw Hats on Thousand Sunny
events.description: Outside of Dressrosa, Nami, Brook, and Chopper continue dealing with Giolla and the Donquixote Pirates. Giolla demands they hand over Momonosuke while the Straw Hats attempt to retake their ship.
events.significance: Shows the parallel storyline of the Straw Hats protecting Momonosuke while Luffy competes in the tournament.

events.title: Brook and Chopper's Submarine Sabotage
events.description: Brook and Chopper suddenly appear next to the Donquixote Pirates on their own submarine. Nami's team successfully destroys Giolla's submarine.
events.significance: Shows the Straw Hats' tactical coordination in defending the Thousand Sunny from the Donquixote Pirates.

events.title: Jean Ango's Bounty Hunter Past Revealed
events.description: Jean Ango reveals that he is a bounty hunter who captured many Impel Down escapees over the past two years. He mentions still intending to capture Buggy, Jinbe, Crocodile, Ivankov, and Shiryu, revealing knowledge of the Level 6 prisoners' escape.
events.significance: Connects the episode to the major Impel Down arc and shows the aftermath of the mass prison break, introducing a character tracking high-profile criminals.

quotes.text: I've turned in almost all of the prisoners that broke out of Impel Down!
quotes.speaker: Jean Ango
quotes.context: Jean boasts about his bounty hunting success

events.title: Luffy Asks About Jinbe and Ivankov
events.description: After Jean mentions the Impel Down escapees, Luffy asks how both Jinbe and Ivankov are doing, showing his concern for his friends from the prison break.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's care for his allies and connections he made during the Impel Down and Marineford arcs.

events.title: Chinjao Defeats Jean Ango
events.description: Jean accidentally hits Chinjao with weapons he was throwing at Luffy. Enraged, Chinjao delivers a powerful headbutt at Jean, knocking the bounty hunter out of the ring.
events.significance: Eliminates Jean from the competition and shows Chinjao's formidable power even with his flattened head.

events.title: Chinjao's Grudge Against Garp Revealed
events.description: Don Chinjao reveals his deep grudge against Garp for flattening his drill-shaped head 30 years ago. He explains that Garp's punch destroyed his ability to split the ice continent and reach his treasure, and vows revenge on Garp's descendants.
events.significance: Establishes Chinjao's motivation for fighting Luffy and connects to Garp's legendary past, adding depth to the Marine hero's history.

quotes.text: Garp crushed my head 30 years ago! I'll never forgive him or his grandchildren!
quotes.speaker: Don Chinjao
quotes.context: Chinjao explains his grudge to Luffy

events.title: Hasshoken Fighting Style Introduced
events.description: Kelly, Sai, and Gatz refer to Hasshoken as the Happo Navy's and Kano Country's fighting style. Hasshoken allows users to control vibrations in their bodies to generate shockwaves that enhance physical attacks.
events.significance: Introduces a unique martial arts style from Kano Country, expanding the world-building of different fighting techniques in One Piece.

events.title: Luffy and Chinjao's Epic Haki Clash
events.description: Luffy and Chinjao charge at each other, both hardening their arms with Armament Haki. They clash with such force that a massive shockwave erupts, knocking away all remaining competitors and even some crowd members. The episode ends with this spectacular display of power.
events.significance: First major Haki vs Haki clash in the Colosseum tournament, demonstrating both fighters' mastery of Armament Haki and setting up their climactic battle.

quotes.text: I ate the Jake Jake no Mi! I'm a Jacket Human!
quotes.speaker: Kelly Funk

quotes.text: As a leader, I will always avenge my men!
quotes.speaker: Sai
quotes.context: Confronting Kelly Funk after Boo's defeat

quotes.text: I've turned in almost all of the prisoners that broke out of Impel Down!
quotes.speaker: Jean Ango
quotes.context: Boasting about his bounty hunting career

quotes.text: Garp crushed my head 30 years ago! I'll never forgive him or his grandchildren!
quotes.speaker: Don Chinjao
quotes.context: Explaining his grudge against Garp and Luffy

themes.description: Chinjao's hatred for Garp extends to Luffy, showing how conflicts can span generations and affect descendants who had no part in the original dispute.
themes.symbolism: Chinjao's flattened head serves as a permanent reminder of his defeat by Garp, symbolizing how past wounds can shape present conflicts.

themes.description: Sai's immediate retaliation after Boo's defeat demonstrates the strong bonds within the Happo Navy and the importance of protecting one's crew.
themes.symbolism: The Funk Brothers' teamwork through the Jake Jake no Mi represents a different form of brotherhood through literal fusion.

themes.description: The episode showcases various forms of power - Devil Fruits, martial arts, Haki - as competitors push themselves to win the Mera Mera no Mi.
themes.symbolism: The Haki clash between Luffy and Chinjao symbolizes the collision of two generations and fighting philosophies.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy faces increasingly powerful opponents and demonstrates his growth in using Armament Haki, while also showing concern for his Impel Down allies.
keyActions: Battles multiple competitors in Block C
Asks about Jinbe and Ivankov's wellbeing
Clashes with Chinjao using Armament Haki

characterSpotlights.development: Chinjao's backstory with Garp is revealed, showing his motivation for fighting Luffy and his desire for revenge against Garp's lineage.
keyActions: Clashes with Luffy using powerful Haki
quotes: Garp crushed my head 30 years ago! I'll never forgive him or his grandchildren!

characterSpotlights.role: Block C competitor and Happo Navy leader
characterSpotlights.development: Sai demonstrates his fighting prowess and leadership by avenging Boo's defeat and showcasing Hasshoken techniques.
keyActions: Avenges Boo by defeating Kelly Funk
quotes: As a leader, I will always avenge my men!

characterSpotlights.development: Kelly reveals his Jake Jake no Mi powers and works in tandem with his brother Bobby, but is ultimately defeated by Sai.
keyActions: Reveals Jake Jake no Mi Devil Fruit power
Merges with Bobby to increase combat effectiveness
Defeated by Sai after attacking with Rarara Rambo
quotes: I ate the Jake Jake no Mi! I'm a Jacket Human!

mangaDifferences.difference: Jean Ango briefly sees Luffy's face in the anime, which was not shown in the manga.
Chinjao ordering Sai to avenge Boo was not shown in the anime. Instead, Sai briefly stood next to Boo's unconscious body before fighting the Funk Brothers.
Jean Ango was shown unintentionally hitting other gladiators when he only hit Chinjao in the manga.
In the anime, Luffy asks how both Jinbe and Ivankov are doing. In the manga, Luffy only asks about Ivankov.
When Chinjao and Luffy clashed their fists, they used their left fists in the anime. In the manga, they clashed with their right fists.

trivia.fact: Episode 646 adapts Chapter 716 of the manga, covering pages 2-19.
This episode originally aired as part of a one-hour TV special alongside Toriko, and was skipped during Funimation's simulcast, later released by Crunchyroll on October 18, 2014.
The episode has no ending theme, as One Piece stopped using ending themes from episode 279 until episode 1071, a span of nearly 17 years.
The Jake Jake no Mi is one of the more unusual Paramecia-type Devil Fruits, allowing the user to become a jacket that can be worn by others.
Don Chinjao's voice actor in Japanese, Shin Aomori, provides a powerful performance capturing the character's rage and determination.

The Haki clash between Luffy and Chinjao at the end of the episode creates a shockwave powerful enough to knock out numerous competitors and spectators, demonstrating the incredible power of Armament Haki.
